timeline.message:
Some Optimizations around BytesArray

* Faster `equals` and `hashCode` for `BytesArray` which is nice since with this change we use it for the search cache
* Lighter `StreamInput` for `BytesArray` that should save memory and some indirection relative to the one on the abstract bytes reference
* Lighter `writeTo` implementation
* Build a `BytesArray` instead of a PagedBytesReference whenever possible to save indirection and memory

timeline.body: I think this is well worth the optimization to not allocating anything for equals and hashCode since we use `BytesArray` as keys in request caches.
timeline.bodyText: I think this is well worth the optimization to not allocating anything for equals and hashCode since we use BytesArray as keys in request caches.
timeline.bodyHTML: I think this is well worth the optimization to not allocating anything for equals and hashCode since we use BytesArray as keys in request caches.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.body: Taking advantage of the now cheaper `writeTo` for the `BytesArray` + this is always cheaper since we never cleverly batch up writes from multiple components anyway
timeline.bodyText: Taking advantage of the now cheaper writeTo for the BytesArray + this is always cheaper since we never cleverly batch up writes from multiple components anyway
timeline.bodyHTML: Taking advantage of the now cheaper writeTo for the BytesArray + this is always cheaper since we never cleverly batch up writes from multiple components anyway
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.body: Why have another step going to the `byte[]` through `ByteArray` when we don't have to, especially with the new optimizations for that case in here.
timeline.bodyText: Why have another step going to the byte[] through ByteArray when we don't have to, especially with the new optimizations for that case in here.
timeline.bodyHTML: Why have another step going to the byte[] through ByteArray when we don't have to, especially with the new optimizations for that case in here.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

replies.bodyText: It's a different stream now. Instead of BytesReferenceStream which generated the previous exception message it's backed by a ByteArrayInputStream now.
replies.author: original-brownbear

timeline.message: CR: less trappy page BR construction

timeline.body:
Just to remind me when I inevitably trip over this in future...

```suggestion
        assert byteArray.hasArray() == false : "use BytesReference#fromByteArray";
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Just to remind me when I inevitably trip over this in future...

Suggested change
assert byteArray.hasArray() == false;
assert byteArray.hasArray() == false : "use BytesReference#fromByteArray";
timeline.author: DaveCTurner
